div.head:
A JUBILEE
For The Nancy Hart Highway

byline.hi:
By Mrs. Loula Kendall Rogers, Chaplain Major
General Samuel Elbert Chapter Daughters
of The American Revolution

lg.l: Let us join the D. A. R.
As they come from near and far
And unite to honor all who did their part,
For our country when 'twas new,
Every patriot tried and true
Now we come to honor brave old Nancy Hart!

lg.head: CHORUS
lg.l: Honk! honk! honk! The horns are blowing!
Let us all be bright and gay,
Cast aside all care and woe,
As we onward swiftly go,
While we glide along the Nancy Hart Highway!
Passing swiftly o'er the trail,
Never mind the Eastern gale,
Sing a merry song of Jubilee today,
Let Old Glory be unfurled
Wave its colors o'er the world
As we glide along the Nancy Hart Highway!
May kind heaven ever bless
With Great joy and all success,
Every one who on this Highway swiftly speeds,
Then, oh, let us ne'er forget
Till our evening sun has set
Nancy Hart and all her many glorious deeds!
